result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald James Leifker Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to the sentence ordered in Lafayette County Circuit Court Case No. 15-CF-65.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay court costs in the amount of $268.00.
Defendant shall pay a DNA Analysis Surcharge in the amount of $250.00.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

timeConds.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:12 AM.
Defendant Ronald James Leifker in court with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant enters a plea of "GUILTY" to Counts 1 & 2, dismissing Counts 3-8.
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights, court also questions attorney Witt re: his clients plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, knowingly and intellegently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" to Counts 1 & 2, Dismissing Counts 3-8.
State moves for plea agreement.
Attorney Witt concurs with the state and makes statement on behalf of his client.
Defendant makes statement to the court.
Court grants motion of the parties and orders defendant to 4 years consecutive to Count 1 in Case No. 15-CF-65 and Count 2 be Concurrent to Count 1 in this case.

Case called at 1:21 PM.
Defendant Ronald James Leifker in court with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Defendant Ronald James Leifker in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Witt informs the court there is a global resolution in this matter, and moves for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on March 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Case called at 9:24 AM.
Defendant Ronald James Leifker in court with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Defendant Ronald James Leifker in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State files information, attorney Witt waives reading.
Defendant enter plea "NOT GUILTY"
Attorney Witt files DDI  Status conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages.
If defendant is able to post cash bond, the defendant shall not be outside of his residence at any time without one of his parents accompanying him.

Case called at 10:29 AM.
Defendant Ronald James Leifker in court with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Defendant Ronald James Leifker in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant provided with a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court reads charge portion onto the record.
Court finds probable cause for filing.
State request $1,500.00 cash bail *no possess or consume any alcoholic beverages *if posts bond defendant shall not be outside of his residence at any time without one of his parents accompanying him.
Attorney Witt argues cash bond amount.
The court grants motion of the state $1,500.00 cash bond with conditions.
Attorney Witt informs the court his client wishes to waive his preliminary hearing.
Attorney Witt files waiver of preliminary form, court questions defendant RE: waiver of preliminary hearing, court also questions attorney Witt RE: his clients waiver of preliminary hearing,
Court finds waiver is made freely, knowingly and voluntarily.
Court orders the defendant be bound over for arraignment.
